H0.text: It is converted into hydrogen and oxygen, which is what eventually happens to most of the water that the living systems of plants and animals take in to continue their processes of life.

H1.text: It is returned to the environment is what eventually happens to most of the water that plants and animals continuously take in to sustain life processes.

H2.text: It is broken down by bacterial decay, which is what eventually happens to most of the water that living systems of plants and animals continually take in to sustain life.

H3.text: It is permanently combined with other compounds is what eventually happens to most of the water that plants and animals continuously take in to sustain their life processes.

A4.text: Transpiration: The release of water vapor from plants and soil into the air.
